title: School winter vacations in Punjab; check latest update on additional holidays
description: LAHORE – Citizens in Punjab have urged the Punjab government to give another extension in school winter vacations due to dense fog and severe cold wave. The schools are set to reopen across Punjab on Wednesday, January 10, 2024, after extended winter break. Earlier, the Punjab government extended winter vacations till January 9, 2024. Owing […]

title: Lahore, Pakistan weather update; fog, cold wave to persist
description: LAHORE – The Pakistan Meteorological Department (PMD) has predicted the prevailing cold wave and foggy weather to persist in Lahore and the plains of Pakistan during the week. As per the synoptic situation, a shallow westerly prevails over western parts of Pakistan. Under these conditions, mainly cold and dry weather is expected in Lahore and […]

title: Karachi, Sindh weather update; fog intensifies in upper districts
description: KARACHI – The Pakistan Meteorological Department (PMD) has predicted mainly cold and dry weather across Sindh during the next two days. As per the synoptic situation, a shallow westerly wave prevails over western parts of Pakistan. Under these conditions, mainly cold and dry weather is expected in Karachi, Hyderabad and most parts of the province […]

title: ECP secretary steps down on health ground
description: ISLAMABAD – Election Commission of Pakistan (ECP) Secretary Omar Hamid Khan has stepped down on health grounds. As per the media reports, he has submitted his resignation to Chief Election Commissioner Sikandar Sultan Raja which has not yet been approved. title: Cold wave persists as Islamabad experiences coldest day of season
description: ISLAMABAD – Blanketed by fog, Islamabad and most parts of Pakistan remained in the grip of a cold wave on Sunday. The Pakistan Meteorological Department (PMD) has predicted the prevailing foggy conditions and cold weather to persist in Islamabad and most parts of Pakistan during the week. title: Peshawar experiences coldest day of winter
description: PESHAWAR – Cold and dry weather persisted in Peshawar and most districts of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa on Sunday with experts predicting the prevailing conditions to persist during the next two days. Mercury dropped to 01 degrees Celsius in Peshawar, making Sunday the coldest day of this winter season. Relative humidity in the morning was recorded at […]

title: GTR celebrates 60 years of driving Pakistan forward
description: LAHORE – Ghandhara Tyre (GTR) has celebrated its 60th anniversary, marking six decades of leadership and reliability with German-engineered technology, perfectly tailored for the roads of Pakistan. title: Prosperous Afghanistan in Pakistan’s interest
description: Governor Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Haji Ghulam Ali says prosperous and peaceful Afghanistan is in the interest of Pakistan and entire region. title: KP govt starts campaign to enhance literacy rate
description: The provincial government of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa has started a campaign titled “Ilm Tolo Da Para” (Education for All) to enhance the literacy rate in the province, particularly in the newly merged districts to the desired level. The approval was granted in a meeting of the Provincial Task Force on Merged Districts held here with the […]

title: Ex-City President of Major Group joins PML-N

title: PDMA forecasts season’s first snowfall in Murree

title: Cabinet committee formed to probe  May 9 violence
description: The Cabinet Division on Saturday formed a five-member committee tasked with identifying the “role of mastermind, planners, facilitators and executors” of May 9, 2023 incidents that saw countrywide violence following the arrest of former premier Imran Khan. On May 9 last year, Imran was arrested by the National Accountability Bureau with the help of the […]

description: A petition has been filed in the Supreme Court calling for contempt proceedings against senators involved in passing a resolution in the Senate that sought a further delay in the February 8 elections. title: Iran Guards commander challenges ‘enemy’ naval presence in region

title: PTI’s Najeeb joins MQM-P
description: Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf founding member and former MNA from Karachi Najeeb Haroon on Saturday announced joining MQM-Pakistan. Najeeb Haroon joined MQM-P after meeting with party convener Khalid Maqbool Siddiqui, Farooq Sattar and Mustafa Kamal. The development was also shared by MQM-P senior leader Faisal Sabzwari on his official X handle.

title: Election Tribunal dismisses Qureshi’s appeals
description: An election appellate tribunal on Saturday dismissed appeals of PTI leader Shah Mahmood Qureshi against rejection of his nomination papers. Justice Sardar Mohammad Sarfaraz Doggar heard appeals of Qureshi against returning officers decisions of rejecting his nomination papers from the National Assembly constituencies of NA-150 and NA-151 from Multan. title: Everton and Crystal Palace draw 0-0 in FA Cup

description: Punjab Caretaker Chief Minister Mohsin Naqvi on Saturday reached General Hospital to review progress on the upgradation work of the Emergency Block. title: Two persons found dead
description: A 30-year-old man was found dead in Sabzazar police area on Saturday. The deceased, yet to be identified, was a drug addict who might have died of a drug overdose. title: Akbari Sarai renovation begins
description: The Punjab Walled Cities and Heritage Areas Authority has started renovation work at Akbari Sarai, situated in Shahdara Complex. According to a press release, the renovation work would cost Rs 32 million and complete by coming December. Akbari Sarai was built during the reign of Mughal emperor Akbar for stay and guidance of travelers and […]

title: IGP visits Jamia Ashrafia

title: NHMP holds farewell ceremony
description: A farewell ceremony was organized by the National Highways and Motorway Police Training College and Central Region (NHMP) officers in honor of IG Sultan Ali Khowaja at Training College. title: Bangladesh poll booths burn on election eve as train arson kills 4
description: Polling booths were set ablaze in Bangla-desh on the eve of Sunday’s general elections, while four people, two children among them, were killed in a train fire that the government decried as arson targeting democratic values. Friday’s fire broke out at about 9pm, injuring eight passengers as it spread to four compartments of the Benapole […]

title: Border violence displaces 76,000 in Lebanon
description: More than 76,000 people have been dis-placed in Lebanon in almost three months of near-daily fighting along the border with Israel, the UN’s International Organisation for Migration (IOM) said on Saturday. The border area has seen a surge of violence since early October, with tit-for-tat exchanges of fire con-tinuing on Saturday between Israeli forces […]

title: Greece restores palace where Alexander the Great was crowned
description: An ancient palace where Alexander the Great was crowned King of Macedonia will reopen to the public on Sunday after a 16-year 20 million euro renovation aiming to restore its past glory. At a ceremony on Friday, Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis called the Palace of Aigai a “monument of global importance”. The fourth century […]

title: Britain hit by flooding after heavy rain swells major rivers
description: Major rivers across Britain were flooded on Friday after heavy rain, with the gov-ernment issuing more than 300 flood warnings, travel operators announcing serious disruption and around 1,000 homes suffering damage so far. A succession of storms in recent weeks meant pro-longed rainfall that started on Thursday fell on satu-rated ground and quickly caused already-swollen […]

title: Japan earthquake death toll exceeds 100 with hundreds still missing
description: The confirmed death toll from the New Year’s Day earthquake in Japan reached 110 on Saturday as a search for survivors in the rubble of collapsed buildings entered a sixth day. The magnitude 7.6 quake struck the west coast, destroying infrastructure and snapping power links to 22,000 homes in the Hokuriku region. Rain ham-pered efforts […]

title: Beirut, Kerman tragedies  and implications
description: From his beginnings as a student leader at Hebron University to his eventual position as Deputy Chairman of the Hamas political bureau, Saleh Alarouri’s journey was marked by struggle for Palestine, imprisonment and a tumultuous relationship with Israel. His martyrdom in an Israeli strike in Beirut came as a defining moment in the escalating tensions […]

title: Voice of the People
description: Articles and letters may be edited for the purposes of clarity and space. title: Someone lonelier than you . . !
description: AND as I look at the New Year messages that’s flooding my phone, I see something that may have escaped many of us, it is that many of us are reaching out! A reaching out to the new year, asking for a change in circumstances, a change from misery, a change from the drudgery of […]

title: Eco-friendly approach to tourism in Pakistan
description: PAKISTAN’S pristine landscapes, particularly its northern areas, are marred by the careless disposal of waste by tourists. Ecotourism emerges as the solution to this pressing environmental threat. This article emphasizes the necessity for all stakeholders to contribute to making tourism in Pakistan more environmentally conscious. Numerous initiatives have been initiated to foster sustainable tourism practices. […]

title: Grading PDM’s foreign policy
description: APPOINTING Bilawal Bhutto Zardari as Pakistan’s youngest foreign minister was quite a daring but also a debatable decision which invited much discussion in the media as well as diplomatic circles.
